metadata.title: CVE-2024-7592 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
There is a LOW severity vulnerability affecting CPython, specifically the'http.cookies' standard library module.When parsing cookies that contained backslashes for quoted characters inthe cookie value, the parser would use an algorithm with quadraticcomplexity, resulting in excess CPU resources being used while parsing thevalue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.12 - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.12-minimal - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.12-stdlib - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.12-testsuite - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
libpython3.12t64 - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12 - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12-examples - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12-full - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12-minimal - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12-nopie - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
python3.12-venv - 3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.12 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.12.3-1ubuntu0.2').
